headline: 2025-10-27 — Authors of the arXiv paper on interactive energy state-space modeling (actor: interactive energy state-space model authors) report implementing their multi-layered distributed output-feedback control on 1 RLC circuit with 1 controllable voltage source (1 circuit, 1 voltage source) to demonstrate alignment of instantaneous power and generalized reactive power.

2025-10-28 — The authors of a correction note (actor: correction note authors) formally identified and corrected 1 serious mistake in the 2007 Proceedings paper by Olfati-Saber, Fax, and Murray, and stated several stronger results applicable to that class of networked multi-agent consensus problems (correction affecting 1 cited paper).

2025-10-29 — The same correction note (actor: correction note authors) reiterated that the interpretation of priority in the 2007 Olfati-Saber/Fax/Murray paper is not exact and flagged 1 specific priority interpretation issue in that work.

2025-10-30 — Authors of the Consensus ADMM tutorial (actor: Consensus ADMM tutorial authors) applied Consensus ADMM to 1 example trajectory-optimization problem for a multi-agent (multi-robot) system, deriving the algorithm from the augmented Lagrangian/primal-dual methods and demonstrating 1 example implementation.

2025-10-31 — Combining insights from the interactive energy state-space model paper and the Consensus ADMM tutorial (actors: interactive energy-state authors & Consensus ADMM authors), researchers propose mapping higher-layer intermediate reactive power control references across 2 control layers (1 higher layer + 1 lower physical layer) and recommend implementing the lower-layer command via FBLC or SMC on physical components (2 layers referenced).

2025-11-01 — The correction-note authors and the Consensus ADMM tutorial authors (actors: correction-note authors & Consensus ADMM authors) together emphasize that corrections to consensus/cooperation theory in 1 key 2007 paper affect the class of networked multi-agent problems to which Consensus ADMM is applied; they note at least 1 stronger result and highlight implications for distributed multi-robot optimization practices (1 affected problem class, 1 tutorial application).
